title: Images Show Construction at a Belarus Military Base. Is It Wagner’s New Home?
description: The images reveal a possible location for the mercenaries who were given the option of relocating to Belarus after the group’s failed rebellion against President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: Ben Helfgott, Holocaust Survivor Turned Weight Lifter, Dies at 93
description: He was one of more than 700 child survivors flown to Britain after World War II. He later became a leader in efforts to remember the Nazi horrors.

title: Research Assigns Wildfire Smoke Back to Its Source
description: An upcoming study links smoke pollution across the United States to individual wildfires and could help predict which fires will be most harmful to public health.

title: Debris From Titan Submersible Recovered and Returned to Land
description: Debris from the Titan was returned to land off Newfoundland, nearly a week after an international search-and-rescue effort for the vessel ended and its five passengers were presumed dead.

title: Missile Strike Kills 11 in Restaurant in Kramatorsk, Ukraine
description: A Russian missile strike on a popular restaurant in Kramatorsk, Ukraine killed at least 11 people, wounded dozens more, and showed the peril of trying to claim pieces of ordinary life during war.

title: Sunny Bunny, Ukraine’s First Ever LGBTQ Film Festival, Held in Kyiv
description: A landmark happening in its own right, the seven-day event also took place during a war — one that rights advocates said has increased visibility and acceptance of the L.G.B.T.Q. community.

title: Prigozhin’s Connections Complicate Any Purge Plans by Putin
description: Russia’s president may want to punish anyone with ties to Yevgeny Prigozhin, but it’s easier said than done. The Wagner leader had substantial links to Russia’s ruling elite.

title: South Korea Changes Age-Counting Method
description: A South Korea law that went into effect on Wednesday standardized how the government counts ages, instantly making residents one or two years younger.

title: NATO Stresses Risk of Wagner Group’s Potential Relocation to Belarus
description: “Belarus is unpredictable and dangerous, and this has not changed,” the Estonian prime minister, Kaja Kallas, said in Brussels at a news conference with NATO’s secretary general. “We are ready for any developments.”

title: Hurricane Adrian Forms Off the Coast of Mexico in the Eastern Pacific
description: The storm was about 360 miles southwest of Manzanillo, a coastal city in Mexico, and was moving away from land on Wednesday.

title: Who Knew About Prigozhin’s Wagner Revolt Before It Happened?
description: Some Russian generals and foreign intelligence agencies appear to have gotten early signals of the mercenary leader’s plans.

title: ‘Barbenheimer’: Fans Plan to See ‘Barbie’ and ‘Oppenheimer’ Back to Back on July 21
description: The “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer” movies look very different. But some fans are planning a double feature for their release on July 21.

title: The Crises of Heat and Smoke Share a Common Thread: Climate Change
description: Human-caused climate change is making high temperatures more common and intensifying dryness that fuels catastrophic wildfires.

title: Mountains Face More Extreme Rain and Less Snow, Study Finds
description: High-altitude regions will get more extreme rain than previously thought, making floods and landslides more likely, a study finds.

title: Welcome Aboard the Aquidaban, the Floating Jungle Supermarket
description: The Aquidaban has long attracted colorful characters as the only ferry in one of South America’s most remote stretches. Now it may disappear.

title: Death Toll Climbs in Kramatorsk Restaurant Hit by Russian Missile
description: The Ria Lounge eatery, known to many as Ria Pizza, was a long-running haunt popular with Ukrainian soldiers, foreign journalists and aid workers.

title: Putin, Projecting Control, Tries to Contain Fallout From Mutiny
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia used a series of public appearances to suggest that the rebellion, led by Yevgeny Prigozhin and his Wagner forces, never stood a chance.

title: Police in France Shoot and Kill 17-Year-Old Driver, Stoking Anger
description: Protesters burned cars and clashed with riot officers in the suburbs of Paris after an officer shot a 17-year-old during a traffic stop.

title: Conservative Court, Moderate Decision
description: A bipartisan Supreme Court majority preserved democratic checks and balances.

title: Canada Wildfires and U.S. Air Quality: What to Know and How Long the Smoke Will Last
description: The ongoing outbreak of fires in Canada is sending new waves of smoke into the American Midwest, and the pollution has been seen as far away as Europe.

title: Pumping Groundwater Has Changed Earth’s Spin, Study Finds
description: Scientists knew the planet’s centerline could move. But it took a sharp turn sometime around the start of the 2000s.

title: Too Many Workers, or Too Few: India’s Colossal Employment Challenge
description: In some places, educated young people are desperate for steady employment in the world’s most populous nation. In others, factory owners struggle to retain workers.

title: It’s Never Too Late to Become a Nurse
description: During the pandemic, Joanna Patchett spent 18 harrowing months in the intensive care unit. She discovered that medicine isn’t just about science — it’s also about heart.

title: In Russia, Wagner Rebellion Echoes Another Coup Attempt in 1917
description: Amid a flagging war effort, a popular commander turned his troops toward Russia’s own capital, undermining the government. It happened last weekend — and in 1917.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Prigozhin’s whereabouts.

title: German Defense Minister Vows Stronger Geopolitical Role Ahead of U.S. Visit
description: In an interview before his first official trip to Washington, Boris Pistorius made clear he is intent on helping the United States by taking a more assertive stance.

title: Russian General Knew About Prigozhin’s Rebellion Plans, U.S. Officials Say
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of Wagner, may have believed he had support in Russia’s military.

title: Putin Casts Rebellion as Proof of Russian Solidity as Belarus Takes Prigozhin In
description: Belarus said it had taken in the mercenary boss Yevgeny V. Prigozhin and might welcome his Wagner troops, while Russia dropped a criminal investigation of him for the weekend uprising.
